headerText: The `v-tabs` component is used for hiding content behind a selectable item. This can also be used as a pseudo-navigation for a page, where the tabs are links and the tab-items are the content.
alert: When using the **dark** prop and **NOT** providing a custom **color**, the `v-tabs` component will default its color to _white_.

usage.desc: The `v-tabs` component is a styled extension of [v-item-group](/components/item-groups). It provides an easy to use interface for organizing groups of content.

fixed-tabs.desc: The **fixed-tabs** prop forces `v-tab` to take up all available space up to the maximum width (300px).

right.desc: The **right** prop aligns the tabs to the right.

content.desc: It is common to put `v-tabs` inside the **extension** slot of `v-toolbar`. Using `v-toolbar`'s **tabs** prop auto adjusts its height to 48px to match `v-tabs`.

dynamic-height.desc: When changing your `v-tab-item`, the content area will smoothly scale to the new size.

icons-and-text.desc: `v-tab`'s can contain icons as well as text. This increases the `v-tabs` height to 72px.

desktop.desc: You can represent `v-tab` actions by using single icons. This is useful when it is easy to correlate content to each tab.

align-with-title.desc: Make `v-tabs` lined up with the `v-toolbar-title` component (`v-app-bar-nav-icon` or `v-btn` must be used in `v-toolbar`).

grow.desc: The **grow** prop will make the tab items take up all available space up to a maximum width of 300px.

overflow-to-menu.desc: You can use a menu to hold additional tabs, swapping them out on the fly.

pagination.desc: If the tab items overflow their container, pagination controls will appear on desktop. For mobile devices, arrows will only display with the **show-arrows** prop.

icons.desc: **prev-icon** and **next-icon** can be used for applying custom pagination icons.

dynamic.desc: Tabs can be dynamically added and removed. This allows you to update to any number and the `v-tabs` component will react. In this example when we add a new tab, we automatically change our model to match. As we add more tabs and overflow the container, the selected item will be automatically scrolled into view. Remove all `v-tab`s and the slider will disappear.

vertical.desc: Tabs can be toggled to stack its `v-tab` components vertically.

props.alignWithTitle: Make `v-tabs` lined up with the toolbar title
props.centerActive: Forces the selected tab to be centered
props.cycle: Will reset to first or last tab when swiping left or right if at the end of indexes
props.grow: Force `v-tab`'s to take up all available space
props.iconsAndText: Will stack icon and text vertically
props.optional: Does not require an active item. Useful when using `v-tab` as a `router-link`
props.showArrows: Show pagination arrows if the tab items overflow their container. For mobile devices, arrows will only display when using this prop.
props.sliderColor: Changes the background color of an auto-generated `v-tabs-slider`

v-tabs.change: Emitted when tab is changed by user interaction

v-tabs-items.change: Emitted when user swipes between tabs.
